Title: b'Magnitude 6.0 aftershock rattles quake-hit PNG highlands as toll rises
Article: SYDNEY (Reuters) - Strong aftershocks rocked Papua New Guinea\xe2\x80\x99s remote and rugged highlands on Monday| as the death toll climbed to 55 from a 7.5-magnitude earthquake a week ago| and is expected to rise further. Three aftershocks of magnitude greater than 5 shook the mountainous Southern Highlands| about 600 km (370 miles) northwest of the capital Port Moresby early on Monday| the U.S. Geological Survey said| including a shallow magnitude 6 quake. \xe2\x80\x9cWe haven\xe2\x80\x99t slept. It\xe2\x80\x99s been shaking all through the night|\xe2\x80\x9d  William Bando| provincial administrator of Hela Province| said by telephone from Tari| about 40 km (25 miles) from the site of the shocks. Related Coverage\xe2\x80\x9cWhat we experienced this morning could have caused more damage| but we don\xe2\x80\x99t know ... it almost threw me out of bed.\xe2\x80\x9d The region had already been badly damaged on Feb. 26| when the largest quake to hit the seismically-active highlands in nearly a century flattened buildings| triggered landslides| and closed oil and gas operations.     The toll on Monday stood at 55 killed| said James Justin| a research officer at the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy in Port Moresby| as news of more deaths arrived in the capital by shortwave radio. Most of the confirmed fatalities were in and around the provincial capital of Mendi and the township of Tari| he said| where landslides buried homes and buildings collapsed on families. \xe2\x80\x9cPeople are in great fear of their lives as the quakes are continuing ever since it started|\xe2\x80\x9d he said.\xe2\x80\x9cThey actually want to know when it will stop.\xe2\x80\x9d  While the region has no major urban centres| around 670|000 people live within 100 km (62 miles) of the epicentre| according to the Red Cross. (Graphic: Papua New Guinea quake| tmsnrt.rs/2ow1YLR) The quake has been felt on global natural gas markets| with ExxonMobil Corp declaring force majeure on exports from Papua New Guinea| according to an industry source| pushing Asian spot liquefied natural gas (LNG) prices 5 percent higher. The company declined to comment on the force majeure| but said production would be knocked out for about 8 weeks. [nL4N1QM0PD] Aid agencies have said nearly 150|000 people remain in urgent need of emergency supplies. Australia| New Zealand and the Red Cross have all pledged aid| though reaching the remote area has proven challenging as forbidding terrain| bad weather| as well as damaged roads and runways have delayed aid efforts. \xe2\x80\x9cThe only way for people to go out is by chopper| and it\xe2\x80\x99s slow for information to come through\xe2\x80\x9d| said Martin Mose| director of Papua New Guinea\xe2\x80\x99s National Disaster Centre| which has yet to complete a full assessment of damage. Our Standards:The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.\n'

Title: b'Amazon has French grocery market in its sights| French boss tells paper
Article: PARIS (Reuters) - U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon () aims to launch its grocery delivery service in France as part of global ambitions to expand in food retail| though the move is not imminent| its general manager for France said in a newspaper interview. The Amazon logo is seen at the Young Entrepreneurs fair in Paris| France| February 7| 2018. REUTERS/Charles PlatiauAmazon\xe2\x80\x99s purchase of Whole Foods in the United States last year has prompted speculation that it could next target the European food and supermarket sector.  \xe2\x80\x9c(Food) is a strong development axis for Amazon since the launch of our Amazon Fresh offer in the U.S. in September 2016|\xe2\x80\x9d Frederic Duval told the Journal du Dimanche| adding that the  Whole Foods deal marked a new step in that ambition. \xe2\x80\x9cWe would very much like to launch this service in France| but everything in its own time. A launch represents an investment|\xe2\x80\x9d he said. Privately held French supermarket operator Systeme U said last week that it was discussing a possible grocery supply deal with Amazon| though a major deal between Amazon and a French retailer has yet to materialize. Amazon has made small forays in that direction and has steadily been building its presence in France| where it has run its Amazon Prime Now express delivery service in Paris since 2016. Last month Amazon said it would create 2|000 new jobs in France and it has also settled a long-running dispute with French tax authorities that had been seeking nearly 200 million euros from the company. In a separate interview with Journal du Dimanche| French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said:\xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xafAmazon is welcomed in France because my absolute priority is to create jobs| and Amazon represents thousands of jobs.\xe2\x80\x9d Le Maire also said that\xe2\x80\x9cpartnerships are under discussions between Amazon and some French groups| notably in the food products sector\xe2\x80\x9d and that the government would ensure fair competition. Our Standards:The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.\n'

Title: b'Porsche could build flying taxis| says sales chief
Article: FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Volkswagen\xe2\x80\x99s () sports car maker Porsche could develop a flying passenger vehicle to compete with rivals in a possible market for urban air taxis and ride-sharing services| Porsche sales chief Detlev von Platen told a German magazine. An employee of German car manufacturer Porsche displays a badge depicting a Porsche logo at the Porsche factory in Stuttgart-Zuffenhausen| Germany| January 26| 2018. REUTERS/Ralph Orlowski\xe2\x80\x9cThat would really make sense. If I drive from (the Porsche plant in) Zuffenhausen to Stuttgart airport| I need at least half an hour| if I\xe2\x80\x99m lucky. Flying would take only three and a half minutes|\xe2\x80\x9d Automobilwoche quoted von Platen as saying. Porsche would join a raft of companies working on designs for flying cars in anticipation of a shift in the transport market away from conventional cars to self-driving vehicles shared via ride-hailing apps. A Porsche logo is seen at a customers center next to the the Porsche factory in Stuttgart-Zuffenhausen| Germany| January 26| 2018.   REUTERS/Ralph OrlowskiVolkswagen\xe2\x80\x99s auto designer Italdesign and Airbus (AIR.PA) at last year\xe2\x80\x99s Geneva auto show presented a two-seater flying car| called Pop.Up| designed to avoid gridlock on city roads. The magazine said that under Porsche\xe2\x80\x99s plans| passengers would be able to have some control over the flying vehicle themselves but would not need a pilot license because many of the car\xe2\x80\x99s functions would be automated. Potential competitors to a flying vehicle made by Porsche would be German start-ups Volocopter| backed by Daimler (DAIGn.DE)| Lilium Jet and eVolo| as well as U.S.-based Terrafugia and California-based Joby Aviation. Our Standards:The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.\n'

Title: b'EU eyes tax on tech giants closer to 2 percent than 6 percent of revenue: Le Maire
Article: PARIS (Reuters) - The European Union this month will unveil plans to tax large global tech companies\xe2\x80\x99 revenue at a rate in the 2-to-6-percent range| though more likely closer to 2 than to 6 percent| French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said in a newspaper interview. \xe2\x80\x9c\xe2\x80\xafA European directive will be disclosed in the coming weeks. It will be a considerable step. The (tax rate) range is 2 percent to 6 percent| we will be closer to 2 percent than 6 percent\xe2\x80\x9d| Le Maire told Le Journal du Dimanche. To those who might say the measure is too modest| Le Maire said his answer was:\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s a starting point. I prefer a text that will be implemented very quickly rather than endless negotiations. We will fine tune it later\xe2\x80\x9d. A draft European Commission document seen by Reuters last month and subject to changes before its publication| proposed a levy based on where the customer \xe2\x80\x93 rather than the company - is located. The charge would be based on 1 percent to 5 percent of the company\xe2\x80\x99s\xe2\x80\x9caggregated gross revenues\xe2\x80\x9d. The proposal aims at increasing the tax bill of firms like Amazon.com ()| Alphabet\xe2\x80\x99s (GOOGL.O) Google and Facebook (FB.O)| which are accused by large EU states of paying too little by rerouting their EU profits to low-tax countries such as Luxembourg and Ireland. President Emmanuel Macron\xe2\x80\x99s government has proposed taxing the tech giants on revenues rather than profits| to get around the problem that the companies shift the profits from where they are earned to low tax jurisdictions. Italy| Germany and Spain| together with France| are spearheading the push for tax reform. They face resistance from smaller nations like Ireland who are a hub for those firms\xe2\x80\x99 investments and fear changes could hurt their economies. Title: b'ICC looking into heated exchange in Durban
Article: DURBAN (Reuters) - The International Cricket Council (ICC) are looking into a heated off-field exchange between players on day four of the first test against South Africa in Durban on Sunday. CCTV footage from the players tunnel at Kingsmead showed Australia vice-captain David Warner and home wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock involved in a fiery exchange as players climbed the stairwell to their dressing rooms during the tea break. The video shows Warner being restrained by Australia batsman Usman Khawaja and spin bowler Nathan Lyon as he directs a verbal barrage at De Kock| who left the field as South Africa\xe2\x80\x99s not-out batsman at the same time as the Australians. Australia wicketkeeper Tim Paine also moves in to block Warner before his captain Steve Smith ushers the opening batsman  away. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s rather unfortunate that the incident took place and certainly not in the spirit of the game|\xe2\x80\x9d South Africa\xe2\x80\x99s team manager Mohammed Moosajee told reporters. \xe2\x80\x9cThe match referee had spoken to us after the day\xe2\x80\x99s play. We will await any further communication from the ICC around this incident.\xe2\x80\x9d  Cricket Australia (CA) said it was also looking into the incident. \xe2\x80\x9cCA is aware of reports of an incident between players in Durban|\xe2\x80\x9d a spokesperson for the Australian governing body said. \xe2\x80\x9cCA is working to establish the facts of what has occurred and will not be commenting further until that has been done.\xe2\x80\x9d South Africa were 293 for nine at the close of the fourth day| still 123 runs adrift of Australia| who will return on Monday to wrap up what appears an inevitable victory in the four-match series opener. A fired-up Warner had earlier given Proteas counterpart Aiden Markram a huge verbal spray after the rookie batsman was culpable in running out AB de Villiers for a duck. Former South Africa captain Graeme Smith criticised Warner as\xe2\x80\x9ca bit of a fool\xe2\x80\x9d and\xe2\x80\x9clike a fly buzzing around your head\xe2\x80\x9d but Markram| who went on to score an impressive 143| played down the sledging as part of the game. Title: b"Australia wrap up 118-run win over South Africa
Article: DURBAN (Reuters) - Australia needed just 22 balls and 20 minutes of play on the fifth day at Kingsmead to secure a 118-run triumph over South Africa in the opener of their four-match series on Monday. The visitors required a single wicket to secure success after South Africa resumed on 293 for nine| chasing an improbable victory target of 417. Five runs were added by the home side before Quinton de Kock was hit on the back pad and trapped leg before wicket by Josh Hazlewood (3-61) as he tried to launch the ball over the boundary. Mitchell Starc earlier had a chance to complete a hat-trick with the first ball of the day after being denied by bad light on Sunday but bowled down the leg side to De Kock| who was eventually out for 83 after adding two to his overnight tally. Morne Morkel was not out on three as Starc (4-75) finished with nine wickets in the match. Australia\xe2\x80\x99s win has been overshadowed by a heated off-field exchange between players at the tea interval on the fourth day| which the International Cricket Council (ICC) are investigating| as well as a charge for spinner Nathan Lyon. Title: b"New British number one Edmund wants 'legitimate' Murray battle
Article: (Reuters) - Kyle Edmund is proud to have become Britain\xe2\x80\x99s top ranked tennis player but the 23-year-old says he would have preferred to have beaten Andy Murray fair and square for the honour rather than inherit it from the injured Scot. While a hip issue has kept Murray on the sidelines since Wimbledon last year| Edmund progressed to his first grand slam semi-final at the Australian Open in January and has risen to a career high 24th in the latest ATP rankings released on Monday. Three-times grand slam winner Murray| who took over as Britain\xe2\x80\x99s number one in 2006| has slipped to 29th in the world. \xe2\x80\x9cAs proud as I am| I would have been much happier had Andy stayed healthy and occupied his place at the very top where he belongs|\xe2\x80\x9d Edmund told British media. \xe2\x80\x9cIt is humbling to become the British number one and perhaps unwittingly| as Andy has dropped down in rankings due to his injury. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m wishing Andy a speedy recovery and I hope to battle it out with him in a more legitimate fashion in years to come.\xe2\x80\x9d Edmund| who has not played since January after a hip injury in Melbourne| returns on tour to play the Masters 1000 event in Indian Wells| which begins later on Monday.
